dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2403 IH: Telling Everyone the Location of data Leaving the U.S. Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Allen (for himself and Ms. Kaptur) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require that any person that maintains an internet website or that sells or distributes a mobile application that stores and maintains information collected from such website or application in the People’s Republic of China to disclose that such information is stored and maintained in the People’s Republic of China and whether the Chinese Communist Party or a Chinese State-owned entity has access to such information.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Telling Everyone the Location of data Leaving the U.S. Act or the TELL Act.

subsection.text: Any person that maintains an internet website or that sells or distributes a mobile application that stores and maintains information collected from such website or application in the People’s Republic of China shall disclose to any individual who downloads or otherwise uses such website or application, in a clear and conspicuous manner, the following:

paragraph.text: That such information is stored and maintained in the People’s Republic of China.
Whether the Chinese Communist Party or a Chinese State-owned entity has access to such information.

subsection.text: It shall be unlawful for a person required to disclose information under subsection (a) to knowingly disclose false information under such subsection.

subsection.header: Unfair or deceptive acts or practices
subsection.text: A violation of this Act shall be treated as a violation of a rule defining an unfair or deceptive act or practice prescribed under section 18(a)(1)(B) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 57a(a)(1)(B)).

paragraph.text: The Federal Trade Commission shall enforce this Act in the same manner, by the same means, and with the same jurisdiction, powers, and duties as though all applicable terms and provisions of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 41 et seq.) were incorporated into and made a part of this Act.
Any person that violates this Act shall be subject to the penalties, and entitled to the privileges and immunities, provided in the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 41 et seq.).
